p: The diverse intestinal microbiota shapes the immune system and promotes the host well-being [ 40, 41]. The respiratory tract microbiota also influences the host immune responses to the virus [ 42]. While the immune responses to viral infection determine the efficacy of a vaccine, the disrupted gut microbiota contribute to vaccine failures and other inflammatory conditions [ 43]. The acute respiratory viral infections disrupt the host-microbiota interactions and create the intestinal dysbiosis with the post-viral immune responses, that contribute to pneumonia development by the secondary bacterial infection [ 44]. The healthy, diverse intestinal and respiratory tract microbiota is then another critical determinant for the clinical courses of COVID-19 [ 42, 45].
